name: The Dealers in Fraud, Defrauding, The Cheats, Those Who Give Short Measure

simpleTranslate: Woe to those who give less [than due],
tafsirTranslate: Woe to the stinters; <N:1>

1: In the original the word mutaffifin has been used, which is derived from tatfif,
a word used for an inferior and base thing in Arabic. Terminologically, tatfif is
used for giving short weight and short measure fraudulently, for the person who
acts thus while measuring or weighing, does not defraud another by any
substantial amount, but skimps small amounts from what is due to every customer
cleverly, and the poor customer dces not know of what and of how much he is being

verses.arabicVerse: الَّذِينَ إِذَا اكْتَالُوا عَلَى النَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ
simpleTranslate: Who, when they take a measure from people, take in full.
tafsirTranslate: those who, when they take from others by measure, take their full share; <N:2>

simpleTranslate: But if they give by measure or by weight to them, they cause loss.
tafsirTranslate: but who, when they measure or weigh for others, give less than their due.

2: At several places in the Qur'an giving of short measure and weight has been
condemned and measuring fully and weighing rightly has been stressed. In Surah
AI-An'am, it has been enjoined: ["You should use a full measure and a just
balance. We charge one only with that much responsibility that one can bear."]
[(v. 152)]. In Surah Bani Isra'il it has been said: ["Give full measure when you
measure and weigh with even scales."] [(v. 35)]. In Surah Ar-Rehman it has been
stressed: Do not upset the balance: weigh with equity and do not give short
weight." [(vv. 8-9)]. The people of the Prophet Shu`aib were punished for the
reason that the evil of giving short measure and weight had become widespread
among them and in spite of his counsel and advice they did not refrain from it.

simpleTranslate: Do they not think that they will be resurrected
tafsirTranslate: Do they not realise that they will be raised to life

simpleTranslate: For a tremendous Day -
tafsirTranslate: on a Great Day, <N:3>

3: ["A Great Day"]: the Day of Resurrection when all men and jinn will be called to
account together in the Divine Court and decisions of vital importance will be
made pertaining to rewards and punishments.

simpleTranslate: The Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the worlds?
tafsirTranslate: a Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the Universe?

verses.arabicVerse: كَلَّا إِنَّ كِتَابَ الْفُجَّارِ لَفِي سِجِّينٍ
simpleTranslate: No! Indeed, the record of the wicked is in sijjeen.
tafsirTranslate: No indeed! <N:4> Verily the deeds of the wicked are in the Record locked up in
the prison-house! <N:5>

4: That is, ["These people are wrong in thinking that they will be let off without
being called to account when they have committed such and such crimes in the
5: The word sijjin in the original is derived from sijn [(a prison)] and the
explanation of it that follows shows that it implies the general Register in
which the actions and deeds of the people worthy of punishment are being

simpleTranslate: And what can make you know what is sijjeen?
tafsirTranslate: And how would you know what the Record of the prison-house is?

simpleTranslate: It is [their destination recorded in] a register inscribed.
tafsirTranslate: It is a Book inscribed.

simpleTranslate: Woe, that Day, to the deniers,
tafsirTranslate: Woe, then, to those that give the lie,

simpleTranslate: Who deny the Day of Recompense.
tafsirTranslate: those that give the lie to the Day of Recompense.

verses.arabicVerse: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
simpleTranslate: And none deny it except every sinful transgressor.
tafsirTranslate: Yet none gives the lie to it except the transgressor immersed in sin;

verses.arabicVerse: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ آيَاتُنَا قَالَ أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
simpleTranslate: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
tafsirTranslate: who, when Our verses are recited to him, <N:6> says: 'Mere tales of olden times!'

6: ["Our Revelations"]: those verses in which news of the Day of Recompense has been

verses.arabicVerse: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ ۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ مَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
simpleTranslate: No! Rather, the stain has covered their hearts of that which they were earning.
tafsirTranslate: No indeed! The truth is that their hearts have become rusted on account of their
evil deeds. <N:7>

7: That is, they have no good reason for regarding the meting out of rewards and
punishments as unreal. What has made them say this, is that their hearts have
become rusty because of their sins; therefore, a thing which is thoroughly
reasonable appears unreal and unreasonable to them. The explanation of this rust
as given by the Holy Prophet [(upon whom be peace)] is as follows: ["When a
servant commits a sin, it marks a black stain on his heart. If he offers
repentance, the stain is washed off, but if he persists in wrongdoing. it spreads
over the whole heart."] [(Musnad Ahmad, Tirmidhi, Nasa'i, Ibn Majah, Ibn Jarir,
Hakim, Ibn Abi Hatim, Ibn Hibban and others)].

verses.arabicVerse: كَلَّا إِنَّهُمْ عَنْ رَبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَمَحْجُوبُونَ
simpleTranslate: No! Indeed, from their Lord, that Day, they will be partitioned.
tafsirTranslate: No indeed! On that Day they will be screened off from seeing their Lord, <N:8>

8: That is, these people will remain deprived of the vision of Allah with which the
righteous will be blessed. [(For further explanation, see E.N. 17 of Al -

simpleTranslate: Then indeed, they will [enter and] burn in Hellfire.
tafsirTranslate: and then they shall enter Hell,

verses.arabicVerse: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ
simpleTranslate: Then it will be said [to them], "This is what you used to deny."
tafsirTranslate: whereafter they will be told: 'This is what you used to give the lie to.'

verses.arabicVerse: كَلَّا إِنَّ كِتَابَ الْأَبْرَارِ لَفِي عِلِّيِّينَ
simpleTranslate: No! Indeed, the record of the righteous is in 'illiyyun.
tafsirTranslate: No indeed! <N:9> Verily, the deeds of the virtuous shall be in the record of the
exalted ones.

9: That is, they are wrong in thinking that there is going to be no meting out of

simpleTranslate: And what can make you know what is 'illiyyun?
tafsirTranslate: And what do you know what the Record of the exalted ones is?

simpleTranslate: It is [their destination recorded in] a register inscribed
tafsirTranslate: It is a Book inscribed,

simpleTranslate: Which is witnessed by those brought near [to Allah ].
tafsirTranslate: which the angels placed near Allah to safeguard.

simpleTranslate: Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure
tafsirTranslate: Verily the virtuous shall be in Bliss;

simpleTranslate: On adorned couches, observing.
tafsirTranslate: resting on couches, looking around.

simpleTranslate: You will recognize in their faces the radiance of pleasure.
tafsirTranslate: You shall see upon their faces the glow of bliss.

simpleTranslate: They will be given to drink [pure] wine [which was] sealed.
tafsirTranslate: They will be served a drink of the finest sealed wine, <N:10>
tanslateWordByWord: They will be given to drink

10: One meaning of the words khltamu-hu misk is that the vessels containing the wine
will carry the seal of musk instead of clay or wax. Accordingly the verse means:
This will be the choicest kind of wine, which will be superior to the wine
flowing in the canals, and it will be served by the attendants of Paradise in
vessels sealed with musk to the dwellers of Paradise. Another meaning also can
be: When that wine will pass down the throat, its final effect will be of the
flavour of musk. This state is contrary to the wines of the world which give out
an offensive smell as soon as the bottle opens and one feels its horrid smell
even while drinking and also when it passes down the throat.

verses.arabicVerse: خِتَامُهُ مِسْكٌ ۚ وَفِي ذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ الْمُتَنَافِسُونَ
simpleTranslate: The last of it is musk. So for this let the competitors compete.
tafsirTranslate: whose seal is musk ' so let all aspirants aspire after that '

simpleTranslate: And its mixture is of Tasneem,
tafsirTranslate: a wine whose mixture is Tasnim, <N:11>

11: ["Tasnim "].: height. Thus, Tasnim will be a fountain flowing down from a height.

simpleTranslate: A spring from which those near [to Allah ] drink.
tafsirTranslate: a fountain at which the chosen ones shall drink.

verses.arabicVerse: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا كَانُوا مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا يَضْحَكُونَ
simpleTranslate: Indeed, those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.
tafsirTranslate: Behold, the wicked were wont to laugh at the believers:

simpleTranslate: And when they passed by them, they would exchange derisive glances.
tafsirTranslate: when they passed by them they winked,

verses.arabicVerse: وَإِذَا انْقَلَبُوا إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِمُ انْقَلَبُوا فَكِهِينَ
simpleTranslate: And when they returned to their people, they would return jesting.
tafsirTranslate: and when they went back to their families, they went back jesting, <N:12>

12: That is, they returned home rejoicing, thinking that they had made fun of such
and such a Muslim, had passed evil remarks against him and subjected him to

verses.arabicVerse: وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوا إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ لَضَالُّونَ
simpleTranslate: And when they saw them, they would say, "Indeed, those are truly lost."
tafsirTranslate: and when they saw the believers, they said: 'Lo! These are the erring ones';

13: That is, they have lost their reason: they have deprived themselves of the gains
and enjoyments of the world and have experienced dangers and undergone hardships
only for the reason that Muhammad [(upon whom be Allah's peace and blessings)]
has deluded them with the Hereafter, Heaven and Hell. They are giving up whatever
is present and here on the false hope that the promise of some Paradise has been
held out to them after death, and they are enduring the hardships in the present
life only for the reason that they have been threatened with some Hell in the

simpleTranslate: But they had not been sent as guardians over them.
tafsirTranslate: (they said so although) they had not been appointed watchers over them. <N:14>

14: In this brief sentence the mockers and jesters have been given an instructive
warning to the effect: ["Even if what the Muslims have believed in, is false,
they are not harming you at all They regard something as we and are accordingly
adopting a certain moral attitude for themselves, for their own good. AIIah has
not appointed you to be keepers over them so that you may be free to criticise
and persecute those who are not harming you in any way."]

verses.arabicVerse: فَالْيَوْمَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنَ الْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ
simpleTranslate: So Today those who believed are laughing at the disbelievers,
tafsirTranslate: But today the believers are laughing at the unbelievers;

simpleTranslate: On adorned couches, observing.
tafsirTranslate: seated upon their couches, they are looking around.

verses.arabicVerse: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ الْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا يَفْعَلُونَ
simpleTranslate: Have the disbelievers [not] been rewarded [this Day] for what they used to do?
tafsirTranslate: Have the unbelievers been duly rewarded for their deeds? <N:15>

persecute the believers, thinking it was an act of virtue. In the Hereafter, the
